      DQM&#039;s rip was not properly encoded and didn&#039;t have any
      ID3v1.1 tracknumbers.

     

      Pure youth. Pure talent. Pure energy. Six words that
      perfectly sum up the sound of the Sweden-based punk trio
      Neverstore. A trio that, if they had been told one year ago
      that in 2007 they would be standing on the brink of
      international success, probably would have laughed their
      heads off. Taking their inspiration from bands like Bad
      Religion, NOFX, Green Day and Weezer, they have found their
      own sound, blending the hypersonic energy from the early
      nineties punk with a melodic sense that makes you want to
      sing along, combined with a tightness that is truly
      impressing. The three guys in Neverstore know how to play
      their instruments, and considering that they have spent more
      than half a decade in the rehearsal place, that?s no
      surprise. Spending their adolescence playing and making their
      own music has also turned them into solid song writers. No
      one-hit wonders here. Playing in a genre that?s not favored
      by aspiring bands in Sweden, Neverstore obviously filled a
      void, because the ever so music-thirsty teenagers have
      quickly taken them to their hearts. The bands debut album,
      Sevenhundred Sundays, hit the stores in January 2007
      alongside with the first single ?So Much of Not Enough?,
      which immediately got heavy rotation on the Swedish National
      Radio as well as the biggest commercial radio stations. MTV
      soon hooked up and gave the video for ?So Much of Not Enough?
      massive support. The same goes for the following singles
      ?Stay Forever? and ?L.Y.D?, that also became Fresh rotation.
      As if this wasn?t enough, Neverstore has played over 80 gigs
      so far this year, including the big Swedish festivals like;
      Hultsfred, Peace & Love, StorsjÃƒÂ¶yran and Pier Pressure. The
      bands tour sold a total of 42.000 tickets! Neverstore have
      also played support to international acts like Good
      Charlotte, Billy Talent and My Chemical Romance. But
      primarily, Neverstore is a band with a strong and steadily
      growing fan base. Their first video has over 50.000 hits on
      YouTube. In the last three months the hits on their Myspace
      page have increased by 200%, now scoring 170.000. They are
      described as ?The hottest band right now? by Sweden?s biggest
      youth community Lunarstorm, and the major web community
      Playahead started a Neverstore members club that within four
      weeks went from 800 members to 8000! To top it all, they are
      nominated in the categories ?Best Swedish Act? and ?New
      Sounds of Europe? at the MTV Europe Music Awards 2007. Their
      new video ?L.Y.D?, hit the airwaves on the 1st of October.
      They are currently keeping themselves busy with the
      pre-production of their next album which they will begin
      recording in the next few months. In their latest video, the
      guys can be seen wearing shades. Go figure, they must have
      caught a glimpse of their own future?
